comment: Very good teacher. One of the best I've ever had. It's amazing that some of the bad reviews are acting all surprised that she will get a little annoyed when no one does the reading. Typical KSU students.

She's very, very good at teaching. Took her once in 1101 and taking her again. I came specifically looking for her, she's the best teacher I've had at KSU and she will make it her goal to know you and your learning style. Her grading is easy but she is straight forward with everyone. There will be no filters. She's funny and class time flies.

I took her 1101 in Fall of 2024 and it was amazing. Don't let the reviews fool you-- the ones who marked negative are usually the ones who got on her bad side. She's great, she's personal, she makes an effort to help you as long as you try. She's not a hard grader, but she gives critiques. Some people don't like that but it's bare minimum.

Dr. Elliott's course is very straightforward with many small assignments such as readings or discussion posts that can be time consuming due in between the big projects. Class time is almost useless when it comes to getting details on assignments. It's only used to see if you completed notes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Elliott is my favorite professor I've ever taken at KSU! Her class this year was the first of her Brit Lit class and while English is definitely not my favorite subject, Dr. Elliott's fun lectures and quite honestly her antics sometimes made the class very fun! Would 100% recommend if you're going to take Brit Lit anywhere but esp on M campus.

She is really blunt and rude sometimes. For instance, she asked what she could do to make an assignment easier in the future for us and I answered. She responded by saying it wasn't her problem when she specifically asked us what we thought. The course material is also not very interesting as it's mostly musicals but that's subjective.
Cool professor don't let the reviews fool you, she's very easygoing
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: The overall rating is very off. I Took professor Elliott's class for British literature. She's one of the easiest classes I've ever took. Just read and write down notes and you'll be fine.

tough grader. did not even let us talk. would cut people off mid sentence after raising their hand, and would rant off topic in the middle of class. had to pay like $20 for all the plays she made us watch and we had so much unnecessary writing and notes. could honestly be a fully online class. do NOT recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: If your going in expecting to write essays and improve writing skills and peer review prepare to be disappointed. We had one paper to write at the beginning of the semester, and the rest was just listening to podcasts and writing notes. She was also just overall rude and not very professional in her speech and would ramble off topic all the time.

Overall very straightforward class. Watch the play that you'll be discussing for the week for hw (usually about 2 hours long) and take notes on important plot points/observations and youll be well prepared. Theres 2 group assignments (one of them is a multiweek final) with 0 traditional essays or exams. Elliott is fairly personable too.

Short-tempered professor. She goes off-topic quite a bit and doesn't really teach us much in class at all. Made us walk in with notes for each day of class and on the second one we would have an unfair 5-Q quiz on the play we had to watch. You have to rent or buy these plays and it comes to be around 25$ for watching these films if you only rent.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: She has a very short fuse and will blow up on a class for not doing their homework. She would even just walk out of class and leave us out to dry, all because a few students did not watch the play that night. I do not recommend her class, she is extremely rude and has little to no patience.
